CSSSign.summary: The sign() CSS function contains one calculation, and returns -1 if the numeric value of the argument is negative, +1 if the numeric value of the argument is positive, 0⁺ if the numeric value of the argument is 0⁺, and 0⁻ if the numeric value of the argument is 0⁻.

blockquote.para: Note: While {{CSSxRef("abs")}} returns the absolute value of the argument, sign() returns the sign of the argument.

CSSSign.returns: A number representing the sign of A:
